Description: Low, ring-footed black-glazed Attic pottery bowl; glaze fired orange-red and partly flaked and worn off (particularly under the foot and at the rim). Wholly glazed save for stand-ring and and reserved with central dot at centre of underside. Wall flaring out from foot into wall, then curving sharply into near vertical rim, which has a groove running along its lower edge. Inside of bowl a continuous curve.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by McLean Museum and Art Gallery, Greenock. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Findspot marked in register; find year indicated only on old label.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.035)
